result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Donald A. Edgington in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Fischer indicates that wishes further time to pursue negotiations with the prosecutor to try to reach an agreement, before the parties turn their efforts to the extensive work that will needed to prepare for trial.

Scheduling order
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Order to Seal Victim Key

[MK] case called at 1:22pm 
Defendant Donald A. Edgington appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Joseph Fischer (Attorney Fischer confirms that he has been retained as counsel on this case).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
recess 1:24pm for the State to check on victim rights compliance. 
reconvene 1:26pm.
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Flint indicates that the State will come into victim rights compliance within ten days.  Attorney Flint cites Statute 950.08(2r). 
Service of the Criminal Complaint admitted; reading is waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Attorney Fischer requests that Preliminary Hearing be scheduled within the time limit. 
The Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no contact with the Victim 
--no unsupervised contact with anyone under age 18 
Mr. Edgington confirms that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
recess 1:38pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on June 30th at 8:15am
Order to Seal Victim Key
